guide.title: Desktop Research Meetings ReportsManifest
guide.abstract: This lists the gentoo desktop research meetings reports.

ul.li: project page : http://www.gentoo.org/proj/en/desktop/research/
manifest page : http://www.gentoo.org/proj/en/desktop/research/manifest.xml
mailing list : gentoo-desktop-research@gentoo.org

body.p: We have set up a core team of devs which goal was to set up a manifest, rules to define how we will work. This step is completed.

section.title: What we are going to do now

body.p: We can start real desktop research, on important issues. Threads will be started on the desktop-research mailing list.

ul.li: some fonts look bad (foreign characters, some rendering problems)
we have too few fonts
a guide on howto set up and use x11 fonts could be usefull
we can add very few work to the livecd and have a working installation
Luke-Jr works on something already, he should present his work
we need to look at GLIS and anaconda stuff too, will be done in next meeting
should configuration be part of the installation, or at first reboot ?
we need to decide a general guideline for config tools, integration with install
we will list and review existing gentoo config tools projects

p.b: bring portage access to the user

ul.li: kportage works horribly, needs rewrite or update, no one seems to maintain it
in a more general manner, decide what software needs to be written to bring portage features useable by any user
gerrynjr proposes to update the existing desktop guide
use the current text as a base
remove the mail and apache sections
see spider's local mail guide
gerrynjr has to work with SwifT, so that it's integrated with new handbook if needed
g2boojum and tseng agreed to review it
desktop-research meetings will be held on a regular basis, biweekly
same day and same time as the desktop meetings, but one week later
desktop guide rewrite should begin now
next meeting topic will be installation
we start threads in the mailing list about x11 fonts problems, config tools, and portage for the mass
